<h1 align="center">
  Basic Gatsby Frontend / Wordpress Backend
</h1>

I made this to learn how to use Wordpress as a headless CMS. To use this template you will need to do a few things.

## ðŸš€ Get Started

1.  **Install Gatsby, Clone Repo.**

    ```shell
    npm install -g gatsby-cli
    ```
    ```shell
    git clone https://github.com/cjaredm/gatsby-wp.git
    cd gatsby-wp/
    ```

    I'm using yarn, though you don't have to.

1.  **Setup Env Files and Gatsby-Config.**

    Next you need to add two env files to the root folder of Gatsby.    
    Andbe sure to copy what is in the example.env.development into your new files but add your own information.
    ```
    ðŸ“¦root
    â”£ ðŸ“‚src
    â”£ ðŸ“œ.env.development
    â”£ ðŸ“œ.env.production
    â”— ðŸ“œ.gitignore
    ```

1.  **Start developing.**

    Make sure everything is installed. It should be already. Then start the dev server.

    ```shell
    npm install
    npm start
    ```

1.  **Open the source code and start editing!**

    Your site is now running at `http://localhost:8000`!

    _Note: You'll also see a second link: _`http://localhost:8000/___graphql`_. This is a tool you can use to experiment with querying your data. Learn more about using this tool in the [Gatsby tutorial](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/tutorial/part-five/#introducing-graphiql)._
